alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Sitka (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 5:01AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The Indian River near Areas Around The Indian River Including Within The National Park. * WHEN...Until 800 AM AKDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Possible isolated landslides in areas of steep terrain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 500 AM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Indian River. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible. - For Indian River at Sitka: At 4:30am the stage was 25.14 feet. Flood Stage is 25.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 24.37 feet is expected around 5:00am Thursday. - For Sawmill Creek near Sitka: At 4:30am the stage was 16.32 feet. - For Starrigavan Creek near Sitka: At 4:00am the stage was 14.39 feet. - For Sawmill Creek Below Upper Tailrace Near Sitka: At 4:00am the stage was 5.93 feet.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
